verses.verse: A <S%H8605>Prayer<s%> of <S%H1732>David<s%>. <S%H8085>Hear<s%> the <S%H6664>right<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, <S%H7181>attend<s%> unto my <S%H7440>cry<s%>, give <S%H238>ear<s%> unto my <S%H8605>prayer<s%>, that goeth <S%H3808>not<s%> out of <S%H4820>feigned<s%> <S%H8193>lips<s%>. the right: Heb. justice not: Heb. without lips of deceit
Let my <S%H4941>sentence<s%> come <S%H3318>forth<s%> from thy <S%H6440>presence<s%>; let thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H2372>behold<s%> the things that are <S%H4339>equal<s%>.

Thou hast <S%H974>proved<s%> mine <S%H3820>heart<s%>; thou hast <S%H6485>visited<s%> me in the <S%H3915>night<s%>; thou hast <S%H6884>tried<s%> me, and shalt <S%H4672>find<s%> nothing; I am <S%H2161>purposed<s%> that my <S%H6310>mouth<s%> shall not <S%H5674>transgress<s%>.
Concerning the <S%H6468>works<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%>, by the <S%H1697>word<s%> of thy <S%H8193>lips<s%> I have <S%H8104>kept<s%> me from the <S%H734>paths<s%> of the <S%H6530>destroyer<s%>.
Hold <S%H8551>up<s%> my <S%H838>goings<s%> in thy <S%H4570>paths<s%>, that my <S%H6471>footsteps<s%> <S%H4131>slip<s%> not. slip: Heb. be not moved
I have <S%H7121>called<s%> upon thee, for thou wilt <S%H6030>hear<s%> me, O <S%H410>God<s%>: <S%H5186>incline<s%> thine <S%H241>ear<s%> unto me, and <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H565>speech<s%>.

Shew thy <S%H6395>marvellous<s%> <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%>, O thou that <S%H3467>savest<s%> by thy right <S%H3225>hand<s%> them which put their <S%H2620>trust<s%> in thee from those that rise <S%H6965>up<s%> against them. by thy: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand
<S%H8104>Keep<s%> me as the <S%H380>apple<s%> of the <S%H1323>eye<s%> <S%H5869><s%>, <S%H5641>hide<s%> me under the <S%H6738>shadow<s%> of thy <S%H3671>wings<s%>,

<S%H6440>From<s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H2098>that<s%> <S%H7703>oppress<s%> me, from my <S%H5315>deadly<s%> <S%H341>enemies<s%>, who compass me <S%H5362>about<s%>. oppress: Heb. waste my: Heb. my enemies against the soul
They are <S%H5462>inclosed<s%> in their own <S%H2459>fat<s%>: with their <S%H6310>mouth<s%> they <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H1348>proudly<s%>.
They have now <S%H5437>compassed<s%> us in our <S%H838>steps<s%>: they have <S%H7896>set<s%> their <S%H5869>eyes<s%> bowing <S%H5186>down<s%> to the <S%H776>earth<s%>;

<S%H1825>Like<s%> as a <S%H738>lion<s%> that is <S%H3700>greedy<s%> of his <S%H2963>prey<s%>, and as it were a young <S%H3715>lion<s%> <S%H3427>lurking<s%> in secret <S%H4565>places<s%>. Like: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin lurking: Heb. sitting

<S%H6965>Arise<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, <S%H6923>disappoint<s%> <S%H6440>him<s%>, cast him <S%H3766>down<s%>: <S%H6403>deliver<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> from the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, which is thy <S%H2719>sword<s%>: disappoint: Heb. prevent his face which is: or, by

From <S%H4962>men<s%> which are thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, from <S%H4962>men<s%> of the <S%H2465>world<s%>, which have their <S%H2506>portion<s%> in this <S%H2416>life<s%>, and whose <S%H990>belly<s%> thou <S%H4390>fillest<s%> with thy <S%H6840>hid<s%> treasure: they are <S%H7646>full<s%> of <S%H1121>children<s%>, and <S%H3240>leave<s%> the <S%H3499>rest<s%> of their substance to their <S%H5768>babes<s%>. which are: or, by they: or, their children are full
As for me, I will <S%H2372>behold<s%> thy <S%H6440>face<s%> in <S%H6664>righteousness<s%>: I shall be <S%H7646>satisfied<s%>, when I <S%H6974>awake<s%>, with thy <S%H8544>likeness<s%>.
